00054 class PropertyMap : protected std::map<util::istring, _internal::treeNode>
00055 {
00056 public:
00058     typedef key_type KeyType;
00060     typedef std::set<KeyType, key_compare> KeyList;
00062     typedef std::map<KeyType, std::pair<PropertyValue, PropertyValue>, key_compare> DiffMap;
00064     typedef std::map<KeyType, PropertyValue> FlatMap;
00065 
00067     struct PropPath: public std::list<KeyType> {
00068         PropPath() {}
00069         PropPath( const char *key ): std::list<KeyType>( util::stringToList<KeyType>( util::istring( key ), pathSeperator ) ) {}
00070         PropPath( const KeyType &key ): std::list<KeyType>( util::stringToList<KeyType>( key, pathSeperator ) ) {}
00071         PropPath( const std::list<KeyType> &path ): std::list<KeyType>( path ) {}
00072     };

00074     typedef std::map<KeyType, mapped_type, key_compare> Container;

00337     template<typename DST> bool transform( const PropPath &from, const PropPath &to, bool delSource = true ) {
00338         checkType<DST>();
00339         return transform( from, to, Value<DST>::staticID, delSource );
00340     }

00343     // Additional get/set - Functions
00345     //@todo make sure the type specific behaviour is as documented
00359     template<typename T> PropertyValue &setPropertyAs( const PropPath &path, const T &val ) {
00360         PropertyValue &ret = propertyValue( path );
00361 
00362         if( ret.isEmpty() ) {
00363             const bool needed = ret.isNeeded();
00364             ( ret = val ).needed() = needed;
00365         } else if( ret->is<T>() ) {
00366             ret->castTo<T>() = val;
00367         } else { // don't overwrite already set properties with a different type
00368             LOG( Runtime, error ) << "Property " << MSubject( path ) << " is already set to " << MSubject( ret.toString( true ) ) << " won't override with " << MSubject( Value<T>( val ).toString( true ) );
00369         }
00370 
00371         return ret;
00372     }
00373

00424 // OK, lets define treeNode
00425 namespace isis
00426 {
00427 namespace util
00428 {
00430 namespace _internal
00431 {
00436 class treeNode
00437 {
00438     PropertyMap m_branch;
00439     std::vector<PropertyValue> m_leaf;
00440 public:
00441     treeNode(): m_leaf( 1 ) {}
00442     bool empty()const {
00443         return m_branch.isEmpty() && m_leaf[0].isEmpty();
00444     }
00445     bool is_leaf()const {
00446         LOG_IF( ! ( m_branch.isEmpty() || m_leaf[0].isEmpty() ), Debug, error ) << "There is a non empty leaf at a branch. This should not be.";
00447         return m_branch.isEmpty();
00448     }
00449     const PropertyMap &getBranch()const {
00450         return m_branch;
00451     }
00452     PropertyMap &getBranch() {
00453         return m_branch;
00454     }
00455     std::vector<PropertyValue> &getLeaf() {
00456         assert( is_leaf() );
00457         return m_leaf;
00458     }
00459     const std::vector<PropertyValue> &getLeaf()const {
00460         assert( is_leaf() );
00461         return m_leaf;
00462     }
00463     bool operator==( const treeNode &ref )const {
00464         return m_branch == ref.m_branch && m_leaf == ref.m_leaf;
00465     }
00466     std::string toString()const {
00467         std::ostringstream o;
00468         o << *this;
00469         return o.str();
00470     }
00471 };
00472 }
00474 
00476 // and now we can define walkTree (needs treeNode to be defined)
00478 
00480 template<class Predicate> struct PropertyMap::walkTree {
00481     KeyList &m_out;
00482     const KeyType m_prefix;
00483     walkTree( KeyList &out, const KeyType &prefix ): m_out( out ), m_prefix( prefix ) {}
00484     walkTree( KeyList &out ): m_out( out ) {}
00485     void operator()( const_reference ref ) const {
00486         if ( ref.second.is_leaf() ) {
00487             if ( Predicate()( ref ) )
00488                 m_out.insert( m_out.end(), ( m_prefix != "" ? m_prefix + "/" : "" ) + ref.first );
00489         } else {
00490             const PropertyMap &sub = ref.second.getBranch();
00491             std::for_each( sub.begin(), sub.end(), walkTree<Predicate>( m_out, ref.first ) );
00492         }
00493     }
00494 };
00495 
00496 // as well as PropertyMap::getProperty ...
00497 template<typename T> T PropertyMap::getPropertyAs( const PropPath &path ) const
00498 {
00499     const mapped_type *entry = findEntry( path );
00500 
00501     if( entry ) {
00502         const PropertyValue &ref = entry->getLeaf()[0];
00503 
00504         if( !ref.isEmpty() )
00505             return ref->as<T>();
00506     }
00507 
00508     LOG( Debug, warning ) << "Returning " << Value<T>().toString( true ) << " because property " << path << " does not exist";
00509     return T();
00510 }
00511 
00512 }
00513 }
00514 
00515 // and finally define the streaming output for treeNode
00516 namespace std
00517 {
00519 template<typename charT, typename traits>
00520 basic_ostream<charT, traits>& operator<<( basic_ostream<charT, traits> &out, const isis::util::PropertyMap::PropPath &s )
00521 {
00522     isis::util::listToOStream( s.begin(), s.end(), out, "/", "", "" );
00523     return out;
00524 }
00526 template<typename charT, typename traits>
00527 basic_ostream<charT, traits>& operator<<( basic_ostream<charT, traits> &out, const isis::util::_internal::treeNode &s )
00528 {
00529     if( s.is_leaf() ) {
00530         vector< isis::util::PropertyValue > vec = s.getLeaf();
00531         isis::util::listToOStream( vec.begin(), vec.end(), out );
00532     } else
00533         out << "[[Subtree with " << s.getBranch().getKeys().size() << " elements]]";
00534 
00535     return out;
00536 }
00538 template<typename charT, typename traits>
00539 basic_ostream<charT, traits>& operator<<( basic_ostream<charT, traits> &out, const isis::util::PropertyMap &s )
00540 {
00541     isis::util::PropertyMap::FlatMap buff = s.getFlatMap();
00542     isis::util::listToOStream( buff.begin(), buff.end(), out );
00543     return out;
00544 }
00545 }
